title: George Michael’s ex Fadi Fawaz alleges late star was HIV positive
text:
Fadi has made allegations about his ex (Picture: Redferns/Getty; GC Images)

George Michael’s former partner Fadi Fawaz has alleged that the late popstar was HIV positive.

Fadi, 46, made the unsubstantiated claims in a Twitter rant, in which he also alleged that George didn’t write his own music and was using drugs.

The hairdresser, who dated George for four years before his death, tweeted: ‘George Micheal was HIV+. We found out in Vienna after his illness.

‘He never wrote his own music he paid other people to make the music for him and pretended it was him. Not so talented after all ..’

Fadi tweeted: ‘Not being hacked it’s actually me’ before sharing a selfie, and continuing on his rant.

He wrote: ‘To wards the end George Micheal smoked his crack using an Evian bottle.

‘Friday night David and I would go to London so he could smoke crack and have escorts over Sunday night would come home to Goring he would be still at it. So sad [sic].’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Fawaz is reportedly sleeping rough following his removal from George’s Regent’s Park property.

Back in July, he was arrested on suspicion of aggravated criminal damage, after squatting in his ex’s mansion.

He was released under investigation the following morning.

George died aged 53 on Christmas Day 2016 (Picture: Sean Gallup/Getty Images)

It is claimed that Fadi was arguing that he was was given permission to live in the house by George before his death aged 53.

Earlier this year, it was revealed that Fadi, who was in a relationship with the Faith singer for four years, had been left out of George’s £98 million will.

George’s beloved sisters Melanie and Yioda received an equal share of all the star’s major assets, including his two London homes while his father Kyriacos, or Jack, has been left a horse racing stud, where he has lived for a number of years.

The Mill Charitable Trust – which George set up himself in 2009 – was given artwork and antiques including a piano belonging to John Lennon and the rest of the £98 million was shared between a host of the Careless Whisper singer’s closest friends.

As well as the Regent’s Park house, the Wham! star also owned a house in Highgate, as well as the home in Goring, Oxfordshire, where he died.

Advertisement

Advertisement

George died of natural causes on Christmas Day 2016, with his cause of death being determined as dilated cardiomyopathy with myocarditis and fatty liver.

Metro.co.uk has contacted a rep for George’s estate for comment.
